title: 13-year-old boy dies in Yacolt of apparent accidental shooting
content:
A 13-year-old boy died Sunday after being shot in an apparent accident in Yacolt.
Family and the teen's school have been notified, but the Clark County Sheriff's Office is declining to identify the victim.
Authorities said they responded to a 911 call just after 1:30 p.m. Sunday reporting the shooting. The teen was taken to a hospital.
Officials said the firearm involved was a .30 caliber hunting rifle, but they are releasing no other details.
The teen was reportedly shot by a cousin, KATU reported.
A sheriff's office sergeant said he couldn't confirm the relationship between the teen and the other involved teen.
Between Jan. 1, 2014 and June 30 of this year, children died or were injured in more than 1,000 shootings across the nation, according to an investigation by The Associated Press and USA TODAY.
The Clark County Major Crimes Unit is investigating.
-- The Oregonian/OregonLive
